title: Complete Guide to Hiding Photos on a Samsung Galaxy

steps.title: Open your Galaxy's Gallery app.
steps.content: Open your Galaxy's Gallery app. By default, it has a burgundy icon with an image that looks like a snowflake. You can find it on your home screen or apps menu. You can view and edit all your photos and videos in the Gallery app. Using the Secure Folder to hide pictures will place your images in an encrypted folder that requires a PIN, password, or biometrics to access. This is the most secure way to hide pictures on a Samsung Galaxy. You need to set up the secure folder before you can use it. To set up the secure folder, swipe down from the top of the screen and tap the gear icon to open the Settings menu. Tap Security and privacy > More security settings > Secure Folder . Follow the prompts to set up the Secure Folder. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Pictures tab.
steps.content: Tap the Pictures tab. It’s located in the bottom-left corner next to the “Albums” tab. This will open a list of all your photos. Alternatively, you can tap Albums and select an image from one of your albums.

steps.title: Tap and hold the photo(s) you want to hide.
steps.content: Tap and hold the photo(s) you want to hide. This places a blue checkmark in the upper-right corner of the image thumbnail. Optionally, you can select multiple photos at once. To do so, tap and hold the first picture, and then tap any additional pictures you want to include. This will place a blue checkmark on the selected photos.

steps.title: Tap the ⋮ More icon.
steps.content: Tap the ⋮ More icon. It’s the icon with three dots in the bottom-right corner. This will open all your photo options on a pop-up menu on the right-hand side of your screen.

steps.title: Tap the Move to Secure Folder option.
steps.content: Tap the Move to Secure Folder option. This will hide all the selected photos by moving them to the Secure Folder. When you're prompted to confirm your action on a new page, provide your Secure Folder fingerprint, PIN, or password to move the photos.

steps.title: Open the Secure Folder app.
steps.content: Open the Secure Folder app. The Secure Folder app looks like a white folder with a key in a blue square icon on your Apps menu. You can find and view your hidden photos in this app. You will need to enter your password, PIN, or use your biometrics to access the Secure Folder.

steps.title: Tap the Gallery icon in the Secure Folder app.
steps.content: Tap the Gallery icon in the Secure Folder app. This will open a grid of all your hidden photos. You can also hide albums within the Secure Folder.

steps.title: Open your Galaxy's Gallery app.
steps.content: Open your Galaxy's Gallery app. By default, it has a burgundy icon with an image that looks like a snowflake. You can find it on your home screen or apps menu. You can view and edit all your photos and videos in the Gallery app. Hiding albums is a quick way to hide pictures in the Gallery app. This will remove the album from appearing in the Gallery. However, they can still be found and unhidden by someone who knows where to look.

steps.title: Tap Albums.
steps.content: Tap Albums . It’s the second tab at the bottom of the screen. This displays all your albums. To move a picture to an album, tap and hold the photo you want to move, then tap More (⋮), followed by Move to Album . Then tap the album you want to move it to. Tap Create at the top to create a new album.

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . It’s the icon with three dots in the upper-right corner. This displays a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Tap Hide Albums.
steps.content: Tap Hide Albums . This displays a list of all your albums.

steps.title: Tap the toggle switch next to the albums you want to hide.
steps.content: Tap the toggle switch next to the albums you want to hide. This hides the albums from appearing under the “Albums” tab in the Gallery app. However, they will still appear in the list of albums under the “Hide Albums” option. Return to this menu if you want to unhide any albums.
